intro: Anchusa microcalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it produces clusters of five-petaled flowers. Anchusa microcalyx is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive blooms and drought tolerance.
